title: Make My Day!
summary: A stress-free learning environment for instructors and students. One question a day.
concept: Students in a class get one question a day by email or SMS or WhatsApp from their instructor at a time of their choice (e.g., morning 8 AM). By taking few minutes every day to answer one question, they improve their skills steadily throughout the semester. The questions are relevant to what is going on in class that week. If they give a correct answer, the system reinforces their answer and gives them more details. Otherwise, it tells when why they are wrong and tells them more information about the correct answer. There may also be optional reading material on the question for the student to learn more.
goal: The purpose of the SUMMER 2022 development team is to create a full stack web application that provides questions to students on specific curated times. The main goal of the website is to improve student retention levels of their classes. By providing a question daily or weekly, course material and information will be able to stick better for the long term.
currentsystem:
Having started from scratch, the current system of the application is an initial build of the website. Given that there was only 10 weeks of development, our team focused heavily on planning and building a foundation that would help future developers. In conjunction to that, the team also implemented a list of requirements detailed to us by our Product Owner. 
 This includes a database schema implemented, login and registration, question system, and notification system.

rolesNeeded.description: Streamline our current React app and launch new features like a simplified household questionnaire, new policy reform creator, and front-end part of a sign-in experience.Please include a link to your resume and/or GitHub account when reaching out.
Design and conduct qualitative and quantitative user research to learn about the stakeholders in DemocracyLab's ecosystem.

title: Churn Detection Modeling
summary: Combating customer churn for for IT software provider Kaseya.
concept: Kaseya is a cloud-based IT and security software company that allows consumers to deliver IT services and help drive business needs. Recently, the company has been interested in preventing voluntary customer departures as effectively as possible. To effectively target customers who have a greater likelihood to leave, Kaseya has been interested in implementing a churn detection model. we are looking to implementing a model that predicts the likelihood of the customer leaving based on a couple of factors.
